ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The course provides an overview of financial crises, both from a theoretical and empirical perspective. The course covers both historical crises and the recent Global Financial Crisis, and highlights avenues for future research in the fields of financial crises and regulation.
Why we need safe assets and banking. How information affects the stability of the financial market.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I enjoyed the mix of theoretical and empirical work covered in the course. It was great to learn both about the empirical facts that characterize financial crises, and also to have a unifying theory of financial crises and how they emerge in the back of my head when thinking about empirical work. I learned a lot about the types of open questions that exist in the literature on financial crises.
It would be better if some slides can be uploaded in advance.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. I learned a lot about the field of financial crises and the work that has been done. I also learned a lot about how to think about financial crises and avenues for further research in the field, and more generally about macroeconomics. The course also helped transform the way that I think about financial intermediation and how the financial sector works, more generally.
Absolutely. One of the most fundamental classes in the economics and finance programs. Should be taken by all masters and PhD students.
Yes, professors are experts in thid field.
